intro: Dianthus autumnalis, commonly known as autumn campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late summer to early autumn. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive central cluster of stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and coastal areas.
